summary: Dr. Jeffery Dormu, D.O., was charged by the Maryland State Board of Physicians for grossly overutilizing healthcare services, failing to meet appropriate standards for quality medical care, and inadequate medical recordkeeping, stemming from medically unnecessary vascular procedures. Disciplinary actions include a reprimand, a minimum 30-day license suspension, two years of probation with mandatory supervision by a board-certified vascular surgeon, required courses in medical recordkeeping and professional ethics, and a $10,000 civil fine.
